Class GameMaster

java.lang.Object
GameMaster
public class GameMaster extends Object
GameMaster.java is responsible for conducting the game, keeping track of whose turn it is, making sure that game-play rules are followed, and declaring the end of the game when one of the players wins.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameMaster

      public GameMaster(Player a, Player b)
      The constructor initializes the instance fields.
      The turn counter is initialized to 1, indicating that Player1 take the first turn.
      The ArrayList to store the Cards is instantiated. The constructor calls the assembleDeck() method.
         The assembleDeck() method is a private method.
         It is given entirely to the student.
         It must NOT be modified.
      The indicator for having a winner is initialized to false.
      The parameters that are passed are Player objects.
      Parameters:
      a - the Player object that takes the role of Player 1
      b - the Player object that takes the role of Player 2

    • GameMaster

      public GameMaster(Player a, Player b, boolean r, boolean n)
      Depending on whether the student chooses to implement optional features, more constructors may be defined to accommodate the options.
      Parameters:
      a - the Player object that takes the role of Player 1
      b - the Player object that takes the role of Player 2
      r - indication of using the random dealing of Cards at the start of the game
      n - indication of reading in a new deck from a text file

  • Method Details

    • play

      public String play(String action)
      The play() method enables the GameMaster to handle each Player's turn in game play.
      A Player's turn consists of either an attack or a swap, indicated in the method's parameter.
      The GameMaster determines which of the two Players is taking the turn based on the value of the turn counter.

      If the play to be made is a SWAP: The GameMaster reports the Player's swap in the format: 
       [PlayerName] swaps out [CardName]...
      The GameMaster proceeds with the swap by calling the swap() method on the Player object.
      After the swap, the Player's turn ends. Even if the Player's swap fails (i.e. one card left in hand) it costs the Player his/her turn.

      If the play to be made is an ATTACK:
      The GameMaster identifies the active card of each Player by calling the getActiveCard() method of each Player object.
      The GameMaster reports the Player's attack in the format: 
       [PlayerName] attacks with [CardName].
      The GameMaster determines how much damage the card-in-play will deal on the target-card by calling the dealDamage() method.
      The GameMaster checks if the target-card has been eliminated by checking the value returned when calling getHealth() on the Card object.
      If the target-card is eliminated, it is discarded by calling the discard() method on the Player object.
      The GameMaster reports the discard in the format: 
       [OpponentPlayerName] discards [CardName].
      The GameMaster allows the Player to draw a new card from the deck to replace the eliminated card.
      The GameMaster looks at the two cards at the "top" of the deck, i.e., at the first and second positions.
      The GameMaster determines which of the two cards has the higher "determining product", i.e., health multiplied by attack-power.
      The Card with the higher determining product is drawn by the Player whose previous card was eliminated.
      The other Card (with the lower determining product) is added back to the deck. The GameMaster reports the drawn card in the format: 
       [PlayerName] draws [CardName].
      The card that was not drawn (with the lower determining product) is returned to the deck.
      In the event that there is only one card left in the deck, the remaining card is drawn by the Player.
      In the event that there are no cards left in the deck when a Player discards, the GameMaster reports in the format: 
       The deck is empty.
      The Player who defeated the target-card is awarded a token by calling the claimToken() method on the Player object.
      The GameMaster reports the awarded token in the format: 
       [PlayerName] gets a token!
      The GameMaster checks if the Player who has just been awarded a token has accumulated three tokens by calling the getTokens() method on the Player object.
      If the Player has accumulated three tokens, the GameMaster's boolean field is set to true, indicating that someone has won the game.
      The GameMaster determines if the game has been won by calling the hasWinner() method.
      If a Player has won the game, the winner is delcared in the format: 
       [PlayerName] wins!!!
      Parameters:
      action - a string that indicates "attack" or "swap"
      Returns:
      the complete message to be displayed as output

    • checkResistance

      public boolean checkResistance(String type1, String type2)
      The checkResistance() method enables the GameMaster to determine if a Card type is resistant to another Card type.
      The checkResistance() method is case-insenstive.
         Dragon cards are resistant to Ghost cards.
         Ghost cards are resistant to Fairy cards.
         Fairy cards are resistant to Dragon cards.
      Parameters:
      type1 - card type of the card being attacked (target-card)
      type2 - card type of the card attacking (card-in-play)
      Returns:
      true if type1 is resistant to type2, false otherwise

    • checkWeakness

      public boolean checkWeakness(String type1, String type2)
      The checkWeakness() method enables the GameMaster to determine if a Card type has a weakness to another Card type.
      The checkWeakness() method is case-insenstive.
         Dragon cards are weak to Fairy cards.
         Fairy cards are weak to Ghost cards.
         Ghost cards are weak to Dragon cards.
      Parameters:
      type1 - card type of the card being attacked (target-card)
      type2 - card type of the card attacking (card-in-play)
      Returns:
      true if type1 is weak to type2, false otherwise

    • dealCard

      public String dealCard()
      The dealCard() method enables the GameMaster to fill each Player's hand with Cards at the start of the game.
      The GameMaster determines which of the two Players is taking the turn based on the value of the turn counter.
      The GameMaster checks if the Player's hand is full by calling the handIsFull() method on the Player object.
      If the Player's hand is full, the GameMaster prints a message in the format: 
       [PlayerName]'s hand is full.
      Dealing a Card increases the turn counter to indicate that the next action in the game is for the other player.
      The GameMaster reports the drawn card in the format: 
       [PlayerName] draws [CardName].
      If the Player's hand is not full, the Card object is given to the Player by calling the drawCard() method on the Player object.
      Since the Player's hand was full and, effectively, a Card was not dealt, the turn counter does not increase.
      Returns:
      the complete message to be displayed as output

    • dealDamage

      public String dealDamage(Card inPlay, Card target)
      The dealDamage() method enables the GameMaster to compute and apply the damage value that the target-card should sustain.
      The GameMaster retrieves the attacking card-in-play's power by calling getPower() on the Card object.
      The GameMaster determines the types of the cards by calling the getType() method on the Card objects.
      The GameMaster determines if the target-card's type has a resistance to the card-in-play's type by calling the checkResistance() method.
      The GameMaster determines if the target-card's type has a weakness to the card-in-play's type by calling the checkWeakness() method.
      If the target-card has resistance, the damage value is halved (integer division).
      The GameMaster reports in the format: 
       [Type1] is resistant to [Type2].
      If the target-card has weakness, the damage value is doubled. The GameMaster reports in the format: 
       [Type1] is weak to [Type2].
      The target-card will never have both resistance and weakness at the same time.
      The GameMaster triggers the damage to the target-card by calling the takeDamage() method on the Card object.
      The GameMaster reports the effected damage in the format: 
       [CardInPlayName] deals [DamageValue] damage on [TargetCardName].
      The GameMaster retreives the remaining health of the target-card by calling the getHealth() method and reports it in the format: 
       [TargetCardName] has [HealthValue] health left.
      Parameters:
      inPlay - the active Card object of the Player whose turn it is
      target - the active Card object of the other Player
      Returns:
      the complete message to be displayed as output

    • hasWinner

      public boolean hasWinner()
      The hasWinner() method enables the GameMaster to indicate whether or not a Player has won the game.
      Returns:
      true if a Player has won, false otherwise (the game continues)

    • gameReport

      public String gameReport()
      The gameReport() method the GameMaster to display a summary of the game.
      The GameMaster also displays information on the game's Players by calling the statusReport() method on each of the Player objects.
      The report is displayed according to the following format (excluding square brackets): 
       ---=== GAME SUMMARY ===---
 This game lasted [TurnCounter] turns.
 
 [PLAYERNAME1]
         [Player1Report]
 
 [PLAYERNAME2]
         [Player2Report]
      Returns:
      the complete message to be displayed as output
